data.text: @HoldentheHorse Well good for you. If a medical "professional" is showing some concern and seeks advice from other professionals why is that to be treated as a bad thing? Yet this whole thread is about criticising that person /shrug

@HoldentheHorse Maybe the concern was sticking a needle into already sensitive flesh area. From what I gather the person was not refusing the jab just a concern about using a tattooed area for the jab, in this day an age of litigious people, concern is better than callousness!

@HoldentheHorse @h0rnedgoddess @Wistfuldragon WTF no don't take their licence, showing concern for a patient is now a bad thing? Sure maybe a bit over bearing but if the concern was genuine why punish them?
@h0rnedgoddess The heck is wrong with these people, I get a flu jab in my tattoo every year without a problem??

Update I'm vaccinated. She seemed concerned that she couldn't do a vaccine over a tattoo (it's Long time healed not fresh at all). I told her in French the first dose was totally fine and she ignored me lmao. Whatever, better safe that she checks and feels okay about doing it.

@h0rnedgoddess SAME. 

Last nurse told me they didn’t want to risk having the ink get pushed into the blood stream??
@h0rnedgoddess Well, I guess it didn’t take long for the uptight moralists to get in on the action. I’d be furious
@HoldentheHorse @h0rnedgoddess I mean really. It's... She.... WHAT.

@h0rnedgoddess Been on with my artist here for his take on vaccines and tattoos, even with as few as I have, and he's said similar about how he doesnt understand the hassle some people have been given over getting recent work around when they get jabbed.
@Wistfuldragon No idea she had to ask like 3 ppl if she could do the vaccine. I kept saying the first one was fine it's ok lol
@h0rnedgoddess Ugh that is so dumb, people find the dumbest reasons to try to tell people what to do with their bodies.
